articles.title: Australia should adopt US policies to attract fossil fuel dollars, says chief of ‘carbon major' Chevron
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Mike Wirth, CEO of a company responsible for more greenhouse gases than any other independently owned entity, wants Australia to be more like the US and Middle East in order to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions like they are in the U.S. and Mideast.

articles.title: Afghanistan's Climate Crisis Displaces Nearly 400,000 in 2025
articles.author: Khaama Press
articles.summary: Afghanistan is facing worsening climate disasters. Droughts and floods have displaced nearly 400,000 people this year and over 5 million people have been affected. Afghanistan is experiencing increasing displacement as droughts, flash floods and other climate change impacts continue.

articles.title: World community should provide emergency assistance to flood-hit people in Pakistan: Prof Cheng
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Prof Cheng has appealed to the international community to provide emergency assistance to flood-stricken people in Pakistan. Pakistan is one of the major victims of global climate change, according to the Charhar Institute senior research fellow Prof Cheng. He is also a senior researcher at the Institute in Beijing.

articles.title: How scientists can contribute to social movements and climate action
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: Despite decades of warnings about climate change, record-breaking heat and escalating environmental disasters have become commonplace. Science has been attacked, dismissed and politicised, and the world is accelerating in a terrifying direction. To scientists, this can feel very unsettling.

articles.title: Canada's wildfires could continue into fall, says government
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: Canada's second-worst wildfire season on record has already burned 7.8 million hectares and could continue for weeks, federal government officials say. Read full story at: http://www.cnn.com/2013/01/30/news/features/canada-wildfire-season-on-record/
